Languages¶

Python¶

The primary language that we decided to use for handling backend tasks of our applications is Python. Python is a cross-platform interpretive language that is easy to learn and understand. The syntax is very simple to read. Since Python is a general purpose language, it is widely used for various tasks. However, Python is often used for web applications. Nevertheless, Python’s popularity has made it a very well documented language. Therefore, if any of us needed to find information on some Python functionality, we could easily look for a book or information on the internet for a solution [1].

Python also has a very powerful standard library. The standard library for python alone has tools for string manipulation, doing complex math operations, opening and closing files, data compression, cryptographic services, operating system services, networking, internet protocols, developing graphical user interfaces, and other useful tools. Since Python has powerful networking capabilities within its standard library, it makes it much easier to program our networking applications [3]. However, if the standard library doesn’t have something we require, than the online Python community has built thousands of different libraries that provide solutions for different tasks. For example, Twisted is a networking library for Python that makes socket programming easier [4].

Python can easily be access from the command line. Therefore, programmers can access Python from a terminal program and develop or test Python scripts. An idea we had for unit testing Python scripts is developing testing scenarios from the command line to make sure Python scripts run properly. Also, Python standard library provides a unit testing framework called PyUnit. PyUnit is very similar to JUnit and provides a framework for test automation [5].

We believe Python is the best solution for our requirements of developing networking application for Hackfest 2010. However, one thing we must keep in mind is that code documentation is essential in Python programming because Python uses dynamic typing for variables. So, it will be important to denote what the specific use of a variable is. The alternative languages we consider for backend operations were Perl, Ruby, and Java. However, after doing some Risk analysis, we decided Python is the best option for rapid development, ease of use, and powerful standard library capabilities.

Flash¶

For our visual front-end user interface, we have decided to use Adobe Flash. Flash is a powerful programming language for developing slick interactive and animated graphics applications. The primary purpose of Flash applications is visual presentation. The other reason that we decided to use Flash is because we wanted our visuals to be access by a web browser. Flash is cross-platform as well as capable of running in most major browser (i.e. Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, etc.) by using a browser plug-in. According to Adobe, the Adobe Flash Player plug-in in 99.3% of all internet desktop computers [2]. Therefore, almost any computer accessing the serves will have flash. Also, if we had an artist join the project, it is easy for him to use Flash for designing visuals. The alternative options discuss for web based visuals was using Ajax and javascript libraries like Jquery and Raphael. However, Flash is the best option for quality and portability on various platforms. Using Ajax methods for display visuals would require more testing through different web browsers.
